sense.name: the act of forcibly taking the opposition
sense.examples: The enemy's capture of the capital city disheartened the citizenry. The aid workers' capture by guerillas has caused an international outcry. Mary's capture of his queen surprised John during the chess game.

sense.name: the absorption of an atomic particle
sense.examples: The ion's capture of an electron gives it a neutral charge. A solar panel produces energy by the capture of photons.

sense.name: permanent gravitational attraction of a celestial body
sense.examples: The trajectory of the comet will prevent its capture by the sun. The black hole's capture of stars and planets increases its entropy.

sense.name: entity in the role of a captive
sense.examples: The commandos reported five kills and six captures. The boy's captures were a turtle and two grasshoppers, but he let them go.
